interests.title: Software Engineering
interests.description: From the first "Hello World" to the latest hackathon project, I've always enjoyed building sophisticated applications through full-stack development. I primarily work with backend technologies, but I'm not afraid of getting deep with UI/UX.

interests.title: Artificial Intelligence
interests.description: This field came to be one of my favorites because it combines the exciting possibilites of statistics with my love for programming. I've done work in both industry and academia with this topic. My current interests include machine learning, data science, and NLP

interests.title: Web Development
interests.description: Building full-stack webapps has become a niche of mine and I'm always looking to grow my knowledge in this area. I'm currently learning Node.js and React.js to build upon my knowledge of front-end and back-end web technologies.

details: Created a full-stack web application that emulates a video-streaming service
Developed several database schemas for thousands of users and video storage information using MongoDB
Stylized the look and feel of the user interface components using React.js
Implemented a secure login system, drag-and-drop video uploading, comments, and likes/dislikes for videos using Express.js
projects.name: PressPlay
projects.summary: An interactive video-streaming service that lets you share and interact with others

details: Facilitated the development of a full-stack online stock-trading app for a course project
Designed the schema and relevant tables to store customer and stock data using MySQL
Customized user interface for different types of users using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Engineered backend operations that support over 40 stock and order transactions using Java
projects.name: SAK's Trading Post
projects.summary: A Java-based webapp that facilitates the operation of a stock trading system

details: Developed a course project that allows instructors to dynamically generate webpages for their courses
Customized user interface functionality in JavaFX to include course events, office hours, and teaching assistant information
Integrated JSON and XML to save, load, and export information and HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to generate the webpages
Wrote over 10,000 lines of code and adopted industry-standard design practices when implementing this application
projects.name: Course Site Generator
projects.summary: A Java desktop application to help instructors curate and maintain their course websites

details: A webapp that shows students and staff of Stony Brook University customized dining options for over 12 locations on campus
Scraped food data for over 300 campus menu options using Python and created API endpoints to access filtered data with Flask
Assisted with the compilation of a user's guide in HTML and CSS that showcases how to use the app
projects.name: Chef Wolfie
projects.summary: A chatbot that help students and faculty at Stony Brook University decide what to eat

details: Trained a linear regression model to predict stock trends based on closing stock prices and Google Trends scores using Pandas, NumPy, and Sci-Kit Learn
Optimized the model to consider predicted stock prices based on daily positive and negative company news in the past five years
Generated smart recommendations based on the trend-line of a stock's prediction model
projects.name: Opus Financial Manager
projects.summary: An ML-based webapp that predicts stocks based on Google Trends scores and closing stock prices

details: Created a Facebook Messenger bot that tracks nutritional goals for Stony Brook University students and faculty
Utilized the Facebook Graph API to interact with the user while logging fitness data in a conversational manner
Won Best Nutrition Hack at SBU HackHealth 2018
projects.name: NutriBuddy
projects.summary: An award-winning chatbot to help members of Stony Brook University stay on top of their nutritional goals

details: Conceptualized, designed, and developed an Android app to complement an online library system for a data structures assignment
Shaped user interface and functionality in custom XML layouts and Android Studio GUIs
Created custom data structures which increased the efficiency of interactions between stored books
projects.name: Jack's aMAzin' Textbook Rentals
projects.summary: An Android app that utilizes custom data structures and ranking algorithms to manage a catalog of books

details: Led a team of seven members to create and develop the robot for a robotics competition
Programmed the robot operation of a colored-block collection mechanism
Integrated code to read in data values from an Xbox controller and output to the Arduino robot
projects.name: C&C Milkshake Robot
projects.summary: Code for an RC robot designed for the 2017 SBU Robotics Team Internal Competition

details: Built and trained several convolutional neural network classifiers on multiple image datasets to explore the correlation between model accuracy and mobile device performance
Implemented data augmentation algorithms and image normalization on data loading scripts, resulted in a 10% improvement in model training performance
Leveraged knowledge in Python, specifically in frameworks such as TensorFlow, OpenCV, and NumPy

experience.summary: I was a multi-semester Teaching Assistant for CSE 316: Fundamentals of Software Development, which focuses on event driven and web programming, software design, and the use of MERN-stack development in large scale apps.
details: Supported over 220 students in CSE 316: Fundamentals of Software Development
Assisted students with software development techniques in scalable software design, event-driven and web programming, databases, and code maintainability
Facilitated student learning through weekly office hours and resolved additional concerns through discussion boards and emails
experience.position: Teaching Assistant for Fundamentals of Software Development
experience.company: Stony Brook University, Department of Computer Science

details: Established security protocols that provide control over permissions using the Django framework in Python
Assisted with the development of the schema to store political data, such as state demographics and boundaries, using MySQL
Integrated the Django Rest Framework to establish routing endpoints for API calls to PoliTech's MySQL database

experience.summary: I spent my summer of 2019 working with the Electronic Trading Operations team and the Performance Engineering Team as a Data Science and DevOps intern.  My main internship project was a natural language processing API to help my team understand commonly asked questions by clients.
details: Developed a natural language processing heuristic that implements topic modeling on over six million tickets to determine commonly asked questions by clients, created an API to provide business insight made possible by the topic modeling
Streamlined ETO's workflow for executing backend cleanup scripts by building a web application that creates and executes these scripts based on user-specified parameters
Decreased the number of logout suppression errors by creating a scalable recommendation system that analyzes client activity and suggests a weekly schedule for monitoring sessions

Leveraged knowledge in Python, specifically frameworks such as Flask and Django, web development languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and machine science libraries such as NLTK, Sci Kit-Learn, and pyLDAvis

experience.summary: During my summer of 2018, I worked here as a Data Management Intern. My main tasks included writing scalable applications to correct and optimize their databases. This opportunity marked the first time I got to work with full-stack applications at the industry level.
details: Created an algorithm in Python that verified over 2000 commercial and residential addresses from old databases
Scraped NYC Department of Education websites for over 1200 public schools that had missing identification credentials used for school verification
Implemented an application that parses NYC public school data to fill in missing credentials for over 800 schools in a database
Managed a computing lab used by more than 300 residents on a weekly basis
Maintained hardware and software requirements for all computers
Assisted residents with technical issues and troubleshot software failures
experience.company: Stony Brook University, Office of Campus Residences
